page.title: 10Birdlife on the Fylde Coast
page.content: The area is one rich agricultural land by the coast.This provides a good habitat for many resident and migrant breeding birds.Large flocks of fieldfare,redwing,lapwing,golden plover,curlew,finches and pinkfooted geese assemble on the land in Winter.In Spring and Autumn there is a rich passage of migrating birds including yellow wagtail(often sees following the cows for small insects),Wheatear to large birds of prey like the Marsh Harrier.A local rarity is the corn bunting which breeds in this area.A Kestrel regularly roosts on the Church Tower and there are little owls and green woodpeckers in the vicinity.Various species of duck breed and herons and swans are notuncommon.When out in the fields it is possible to flush out snipe,partridge and pheasants.
